title: MarsMiningCo
author: MarsMiningCo
content: hi guysDont know if i am asking a question that has been asked before.Is there a website that reports which BTC address won the block reward?ThanksMars

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You can use block explorer to check the details pertaining to a block, including the rewarded miner address. You can use:https://blockchair.comhttps://mempool.spacehttps://www.blockchain.com/explorerInput the block to search for it on any of the sites mentioned above.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Are you talking about coinbase addresses?Mempool.space should give you enough insight about blocks including what addresses where the new BTC is generated or wins a block.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on October 04, 2023, 09:27:21 PMMempool.space should give you enough insight about blocks including what addresses where the new BTC is generated or wins a block.Yes. But that is the work of blockchain explorers. There is also another one that I do use but not included up there which is https://blockstream.info. If the block is searched for on the blockchain explorer, he will also see what he is looking for there.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: MarsMiningCo on October 04, 2023, 09:08:34 PMhi guysDont know if i am asking a question that has been asked before.Is there a website that reports which BTC address won the block reward?ThanksMarsJust look for any  blockThe first transaction is the coinbase transaction, I.e., the block reward.For examplehttps://mempool.space/block/000000000000000000032132d8c543b466fcab067d95ddff612d5f586cf409b2Transaction https://mempool.space/tx/63fc50ea81f4173a699b55060e50f595694a5fc6fb51026f8c1d2314cee270d5You can see the transaction has no inputs. Those coins were created with the block

comments.author: MarsMiningCo
comments.body: hi guysthanks for the information.  this is what i was looking for and it was right under my nose lolthank you all for your feedbackMars

comments.author: SquirrelJulietGarden
comments.body: Quote from: MarsMiningCo on October 04, 2023, 09:08:34 PMIs there a website that reports which BTC address won the block reward?Check there https://btc.com/stats/pool. It is for Pool distribution.You will have a table of Bitcoin mining pools. Click on a pool, like Foundry USA you will see a list of Bitcoin blocks found by that pool and block hash including the Coinbase transaction.Like this block hash: https://explorer.btc.com/btc/block/0000000000000000000234bb67003ad648f9bb953c9b6d45dd9429bb8651f5d3
